title: The Art of Negotiation
description:
Master the psychology and tactics of effective negotiation through lessons from the world's foremost experts. This course brings together FBI hostage negotiators, Harvard professors, Nobel Prize winners, and behavioral scientists to teach you how to read people, create value, handle difficult conversations, and reach agreements that last.

You'll learn from Chris Voss, the FBI's former lead international hostage negotiator who now teaches his 'Never Split the Difference' tactics to business leaders worldwide. William Ury, co-founder of the Harvard Program on Negotiation, shares the timeless 'Getting to Yes' principles that revolutionized conflict resolution. Nobel laureate Daniel Kahneman reveals how cognitive biases sabotage our decisions, while Robert Cialdini—the 'Godfather of Influence'—breaks down the seven principles of persuasion.

Beginner episodes feature accessible conversations with world-class experts, making FBI tactics and Harvard frameworks immediately applicable whether you're buying a car, asking for a raise, or resolving a conflict. Intermediate content dives deeper into behavioral economics, organizational psychology, and the neuroscience of decision-making. Advanced episodes tackle high-stakes scenarios like international peace negotiations, venture capital deal-making, and de-biasing strategies that separate good negotiators from great ones.

Each episode adds practical tools to your negotiation toolkit—from tactical empathy and body language reading to game theory and emotional intelligence. These aren't theoretical concepts; they're battle-tested techniques from experts who've negotiated hostage releases, brokered billion-dollar deals, and mediated international conflicts. Whether you're navigating workplace dynamics, family disputes, or business deals, this course gives you the frameworks and confidence to negotiate anything.
